newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia peso ends down 5.5, lowest since July 30.
newsitem.headline: Colombia peso ends down 5.5, lowest since July 30.

text.p: Colombia's peso rallied slightly in the second half of Tuesday's session to end down 5.5 pesos against the dollar at 1,056.7, interbank traders said.
At midsession, the peso plummeted eight pesos and despite the rebound closed at its lowest level since July 30.

Dealers said there had been strong demand for greenbacks from the public sector, looking to service debt, and from medical laboratories paying off imports. They said many private sector companies were also pay off foreign debts early, in anticipation of further falls in the peso.
The latest drop comes the day after the Colombian currency lost 15.65 pesos against the dollar on Monday.
